Nostalgic f2p zombie survival. Crafting, base-building, and multiplayer are fun and addictive, and the community keeps it lively even today. The graphics are simple, but that doesn‚Äôt take away the fun.

Unturned remains a solid pick ‚Äî especially if you‚Äôre looking for a free survival sandbox to play with friends, enjoy exploring, building or just messing around in a zombie world. The community and modding support give it longevity.
However ‚Äî if you prioritise top-tier graphics, finely honed survival mechanics or a massive, uniformly populated modern game with all the latest bells and whistles, you may find it a little wanting or dated.

Final Call:
Jump in and have fun, particularly in a good server or with friends ‚Äî but go in with the understanding that Unturned‚Äôs greatest strengths lie in community and freedom, not in cutting-edge visuals or ultra-refined systems.

Really fun and enjoyable. It‚Äôs simple, smooth, and entertaining, with great gameplay and good vibes all around. Addictive and satisfying, I keep coming back for more. Overall, a solid game that‚Äôs fun, relaxing, and has just the right amount of challenge.
The coolest game possible I had a lot of fun playing this game and I'm still having fun whoever installs it is the smartest I love you people

Unturned is the game where I log in for a chill survival session and immediately get bitten, shot, or blown up by something I didn‚Äôt even see. Zombies are relentless, bases collapse in hilarious ways, and somehow I end up running naked across the map yelling at a tree for cover. Ridiculous, brutal, and endlessly entertaining.

>join 10x for easy start
>spawn
>find a hammer and baton
>get sniped from somewhere
>respawn
>get spawnkilled
>respawn
>get killed while trying to leave ur spawn area
>respawn
>finally escape ur spawn
>run to nearest building
>full of dead bodies and loot
>get shot at from a window across the street
>grab 4 diff guns
>only 1 has ammo
>tanto pistol
>fire blindly
>you actually kill them
>realise its night time
>20 zombies storm in and maul you to death because youre an idiot
>die
>quit

Ignore the hours - that's mainly due to me never turning off the game OR my computer... for several nights.. I WAS LIKE 12 OKAY - LEAVE ME ALONE!! 

But seriously, besides the nights that Unturned was left open, I was playing the everloving crap out of this game. Only thing that keeps me coming back is how simple it is.
Yea I could find a minecraft mod/modpack or a roblox game similar, but its not going to have the same feel as unturned. I've also tried other zombie games (mainly project zomboid) and find that they're just not as enjoyable as unturned either. 

Maybe I'm just bad - but i still recommend at least checking out this game.

negative.review: Played this game back in the old version and multiple times as it got updates. And this game has just become boring. It isn't survival and it sure as hell isn't singleplayer, all the maps (especially the new ones) are made only with PVP in mind to the point where you don't even need to really reload, you can just drop the gun and pick up a new one. And if you are playing offline all you need to do is find a axe and a saw, thats it. After that, you can play hoarding simulator. Older maps don't get updated with time and to make zombies more deadly they just make them bullet sponges, A4 to the head takes multiple shots and a car gets stopped and even pushed back if you try to run them over

I appreciate that it was free, but it's honestly kinda trash. It doesn't really feel like the zombies even matter. They never move and barely do anything unless you just don't see them and there's just too much focus on PVP. To be honest, DayZ would definitely be a much better choice if this is your type of game.

We're never getting the next game overhaul :(
current game version just isnt fun, its so janky and outdated.

This is the game I grew up with. I remeber the august mornings during the weekends, I had soccer practice and I really didn't give a flying fuck about soccer, all I wanted to do was go back home and play this new game I found called unturned. I remeber the first time playing unturned, I was crouching around Seattle during the night, figuring out how to use a mic and asking if anyone was around me before getting scared and logging off. Throughout the years I've hopped on this game on and off, even got my mom into it a little and got her a gold upgrade as a mothers day gift when I was 8 lol. Man I miss those days when Unturned was more of a survival game than a pvp game with a hunger and thirst system that doesn't even matter anymore because people are too scared to go over easy mode. I wish this game would bring an update with some good survival mechanics but until then I have to give my favorite game of all time a no on recommendations.
i couldnt leave the game because it dosent let you for a while after opening the menu

Played it back in 2015. It was fun. Picked it up today. Since those ten years there's been pretty much no new content apart from maps that have been made by the community. As far as I'm aware the dev(s) doesn't/don't add much if anything new from themselves. Just one of those PvPvE games which turned out quite meh. Also it's 2025 and the game still doesn't host servers through Steam. Gotta set up your own dedicated server which isn't difficult, just a bit ass and clunky.
Download when your 15 and dont have any money type game. Seriously, What do you expect? It's video game.

its a ok game i guess, but it can be better.

3/10 Just a generic pvp game. This game has nothing to do with zombies.

Pros:

-PVP 
-Mod Support
-Easy Multiplayer
-Smooth controls

Cons:

-PVE. The zombies become trivially easy in the first 5 minutes.
-Loot progression. You can have the best loot in the game in 5 minutes because military areas aren't any harder than regular areas.
-Weak survival mechanics. You have infinite food and water and heals very easily
-No endgame or difficult challenges

I blasted the developer for not attracting new players to the game. The game has so much potential, yet the player base keeps dropping every year and servers are shutting down. The dev keeps releasing pointless updates that don‚Äôt bring in any new players. The dumbest update ever was when they made the microphone turned off by default ‚Äî many players didn‚Äôt even know how to turn it back on, and after that the servers became quieter than a graveyard.

Played this game back in the old version and multiple times as it got updates. And this game has just become boring. It isn't survival and it sure as hell isn't singleplayer, all the maps (especially the new ones) are made only with PVP in mind to the point where you don't even need to really reload, you can just drop the gun and pick up a new one. And if you are playing offline all you need to do is find a axe and a saw, thats it. After that, you can play hoarding simulator. Older maps don't get updated with time and to make zombies more deadly they just make them bullet sponges, A4 to the head takes multiple shots and a car gets stopped and even pushed back if you try to run them over
literally my childhood game, but the creator is a hypocrite that doesn't care about the community, even though the community has kept the game alive with curated maps

As a former Unturned Player who played PEI to Elver, I'm going to leave a thumbs down on this. Why you ask? Because I've seen the drama and it's not great, Nelson Sexton.. 

For years I've been patiently waiting for this game to be a middle ground between nostalgic times and improving the game performance so that it can run potato graphic pcs can still run the game..

But now, I see games rise and fall due to huge mistakes.. because some people are either power hungry greedy.. or manipulative mastermind sort of people.. or even an ahole.. 

Either way, I'm not going to wait anymore and leave this game for good, my hope for this game is all but lost to the abyss now..

P.S: Thx so much for the OG Elver devs, they're the best.. the best of the best at story telling..

The game's developer Nelson is ignoring hard working creators while punishing the rest for years modders and map makers have built this game with sweat and passion, only have their work tossed apart.

Creatos are getting blocked and their hardwork erased, while Nelson keep making changes helping his personal friends rather than the community.

I feel that one reason is Nelson believes he's losing control over the design/creative process of Unturned and as such is seeking to regain control. Another reason could be that Nelson is worried about the personal/private activities of some of the developers and doesn't want it damaging the image of Unturned, himself, and SDG.

I hope Nelson can come out himself and make things clear, rather than having his wife be a liason for the community 
thereforementioned example happened months ago, im not sure if it still stands). 

If Nelson decides to go public about what he is expecting for the future of Unturned, reiterating and/or creating new expectations and guidelines for developers, with also a full explanation as to why a lot of maps and developers were suddenly removed, would help in rebuilding trust and interest in the game. 

It is sad to see that Nelson, who left the Roblox platform in part due to unfair treatment of its developers, seems to be going towards the same direction with Unturned.

You either die a hero or live long enough to see yourself become the villain. I've been playing this game since 2016. I hate the current state of it. This is not the unturned i would spend 4 days straight playing until exhaustion. Nelson Sexton is a shitty developer.

This is the game I grew up with. I remeber the august mornings during the weekends, I had soccer practice and I really didn't give a flying fuck about soccer, all I wanted to do was go back home and play this new game I found called unturned. I remeber the first time playing unturned, I was crouching around Seattle during the night, figuring out how to use a mic and asking if anyone was around me before getting scared and logging off. Throughout the years I've hopped on this game on and off, even got my mom into it a little and got her a gold upgrade as a mothers day gift when I was 8 lol. Man I miss those days when Unturned was more of a survival game than a pvp game with a hunger and thirst system that doesn't even matter anymore because people are too scared to go over easy mode. I wish this game would bring an update with some good survival mechanics but until then I have to give my favorite game of all time a no on recommendations.
i couldnt leave the game because it dosent let you for a while after opening the menu

Played it back in 2015. It was fun. Picked it up today. Since those ten years there's been pretty much no new content apart from maps that have been made by the community. As far as I'm aware the dev(s) doesn't/don't add much if anything new from themselves. Just one of those PvPvE games which turned out quite meh. Also it's 2025 and the game still doesn't host servers through Steam. Gotta set up your own dedicated server which isn't difficult, just a bit ass and clunky.
Download when your 15 and dont have any money type game. Seriously, What do you expect? It's video game.

its a ok game i guess, but it can be better.
for those who want to buy though, just save money for dayz, even though this is free.
one of the worst games i have ever had the displeasure of playing. it punishes you for everything you do.

Was going to post a good review, but an this program is trash, the graphics I could have accepted, its what is shown, but the user interface and the crafting menus are just a total mess, I have to craft a table, but searching for the crafting recipie or ingredients required is all over the place. tried to find the stupid blowtorch recipie a tool you need to make another station....why do I have to search for it everywhere and still not find it, I click the tabs for tool and it gives me things besides tools.

game is great but one shit mechanic, i died and 70% of my stuff despawned, it would be better if the game allowed me to hold shift and click so i can retrieve most of my stuff and the stupid bed glitched out so when i spawn home it spawned me a kilometer away from the bed, fucking developer get your head in the game

This game is only alive because of the community, and the map they make. Official updates and content to the game is barely made nowadays, and any new update don't really improve upon the game's enjoyability. The game is also poorly optimized, the game randomly freezing sometimes for no reason at all. It also does not help that this game has predatory lootbox mechanics as seen in games like CSGO.
terrible game, singleplayer or multi, public servers are toxic. do NOT waste your time on this like me and my friend did.
Game unfortunately has lost it's purpose. To provide a platform of impartiality. Instead, this has become the demon it swore to defend, meanwhile other games are capitalizing on that.

it's time to let this game go.

as of 2025, this game is gustavo fring lospolloshermanos disapproved.

As a vetern of 4-5 years and after returning to the game i am very upset to see what this game has come to nothing new I have to get mods just for something existing, idk why but i dont think the actually dev does anything anymore for the game which is sad, i hope to see this game return to its former glory and as someone who doesnt typically like leaving reviews just refund the games that annoy me or just suck but as this is a free to play MY FINAL WORDS "This Game dukey now if i could i would refund it and to those that would play this game just play a actual good game like zomboid"

I Installed the Game beacuse it looked intresting. I booted up the game, i clicked play and it made me install a map that took half an hour to install. After that there was a loading screen that took 5 minuets to load, when i finally loaded in my game was laggy then crashed, Would not recommend.

3/10 Just a generic pvp game. This game has nothing to do with zombies.

Pros:

-PVP 
-Mod Support
-Easy Multiplayer
-Smooth controls

Cons:

-PVE. The zombies become trivially easy in the first 5 minutes.
-Loot progression. You can have the best loot in the game in 5 minutes because military areas aren't any harder than regular areas.
-Weak survival mechanics. You have infinite food and water and heals very easily
-No endgame or difficult challenges
no good support for servers with friends. total cheeks if you have friends. really fun if youre lonely
This is rust/state of decay but better. Despite the fact that it is better, it is still the same type of game, so it sucks.

I am quitting UNTURNED because it's a ridiculous system. Nelson Sexton does whatever he can do to help his favorite players and curated developers. Neglecting his community and his game. Being the first ever game ive owned and played on steam with my friends, Nelson Sexton has let down me and his community with his actions and has proven himself incompetent at game design and as a leader of a community. It DOES NOT seem worth it to me and many others to continue to play or make content for this game any longer, especially if the game developer will eventually steal curated content, claim it as his own, and everyone will fall for it.
